meanings.definition: To date (a document) with a date earlier than the current date.
meanings.sent1: She backdated the contract to make it seem like it was signed last month.
meanings.sent2: The accountant backdated the invoices to show they were paid on time.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly backdated the permission slip to avoid any issues.
meanings.sent4: His apology was like a backdated check, trying to make up for lost time.
meanings.sent5: The detective's evidence was as clear as a backdated receipt.

meanings.definition: Dated with a date earlier than the current date.
meanings.sent1: The backdated letter caused confusion among the recipients.
meanings.sent2: The backdated report was discovered during the audit.
meanings.sent3: The backdated invitation made the event seem like a blast from the past.
meanings.sent4: Her backdated diary entries revealed her true feelings at the time.
meanings.sent5: The backdated newspaper was a treasure trove of historical information.
